title: [Large-scale] Flipped Learning-Based Short-Term Intensive Mathematics Course: Applying First Principles of Instruction

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts (middle school level)
context.additional_context: Conducted in a microlearning environment utilizing digital devices (smartphones/tablets), learners watch pre-class video lectures and then engage in advanced activities during in-class sessions.

learning_goals: Explaining the five core mathematical concepts (functions, equations, geometry, statistics, and calculus basics) with over 80% accuracy within the first week in a flipped learning environment
Presenting creative approaches three or more times during peer-evaluated problem-solving processes in classroom sessions after watching video lectures
Demonstrating learning outcomes by achieving at least 70 points (out of 100) on the comprehensive final assessment
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
